title: How to check the cores of a laptop processor - Quora

response.answer_text: you have a simple 2 way to check your Processor core fine out below step. first way Open task manager (Press key combination Ctrl+Shift+Esc)go to Performance Tabselected Processor Optionnow you can see detail regarding Processor, see the right-hand side lower Processor detail base speed, sockets, Cores, Logical Processor, Virtualization, L1, L2, L3, and some other detail of Processor. see the attached below image for your reference.  second way goto device manager (type this command in Run = devmgmt.msc) and file the Processor in the device list and expanded you can see all core of the Processor see the attached below image for your reference.

If you are using a laptop of windows 7, 8.1, 10. Then you can just open the task manager and see the logical cores and threads’ of your CPU. And even see how much percentage is your CPU is working in your PC in per 60 sec. And also you can check what CPU are using here and also the gen and the tier of the gen you are using. Plus you can also see other things too like the memory is been used etc. This the most easy and detailed way to go when using a windows’ laptop and desktop. Have a nice day.
